posts.post_content: Red could have trouble with this, mainly due to lifelink. Black and white just point their next removal spell at it. Blue counters it. Green might not be able to kill it, but as long as you're not mono-green this should not be a problem. [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) was very good back in the days, but time passes and the game changes. I think Baneslayer is good, but fair.

posts.post_content:
Angels we have heard on high, gently sweeping o'er five Plains
  
And the Mountains in reply, soon filled with Dragon bloodstains
  
Broooo-o-o-o-o-oooooo-o-o-o-o-oooooooo-o-o-o-o-oooo-o-ken
  
Goodbye Serra Aaaa-aaan-gel...
  
On second thought, I'm being a tad overdramatic. There's no way red could get a Dragon out in time to watch it not block and have its attack damage negated by lifelink. Thank Garfield for kill spells.

Posted By: Mode (7/12/2009 4:00:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is clearly a 5/5 star card in a vacuum, but the fact that it truly seems to throw any semblance of balance out the window is very frustrating. At the very least, it should have been legendary-- even then, it's undercosted. Hell, [Xanthrid Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xanthrid Demon) costs more than this, and you have to feed it a creature every turn! Oh, and Xanthrid is the **only** flyer in the set naturally bigger than this guy, but even he can't kill her because of protection! Absurdo card.
posts.html:

Posted By: EvO (7/19/2009 3:31:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5cc for a 5/5 is bland and somewhat mediocre for a vanilla creature. Add in flying, and you have a fair, but cheap creature. Then you give it first strike, lifelink, and some half-assed protection, and you have an insanely cheap card. Rarity does not provide sufficient balance. If it was like 4WWW, it would be fine. Even maybe 3WWW. 3WW means that it will go down early, and will dominate the field.  
  
Horribly unbalanced. I opened one, read it, considered trading it. Read it again, decided against trading. Even if I never use my white deck, it's nice knowing I have a Baneslayer in it.
posts.html:

Even maybe 3WWW. 3WW means that it will go down early, and will dominate the field.

Horribly unbalanced. I opened one, read it, considered trading it. Read it again, decided against trading. Even if I never use my white deck, it's nice knowing I have a Baneslayer in it.
